Package entity

Class Ray

java.lang.Object
interfaces.Moveable
entity.Ray
public class Ray extends Moveable
Represents an invisible object used to implement basic ray casting. This class is used by the isViewable method of the Screen class to obscure tiles and entities behind walls that the player cannot see.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Ray

      public Ray(double x, double y, double rad)
      Constructs a new Ray object with an initial position and direction. The velocity is always 1.0 tiles/frame, which is the maximum distance required to avoid skipping tiles. The initial size of the ray is 0 tiles.
      Parameters:
      x - the initial x position of the ray (e.g. player.getX().
      y - the initial y position of the ray (e.g. player.getY().
      rad - the direction, relative to the unit circle, that the ray is cast.

  • Method Details

    • inRange

      public boolean inRange(double targetX, double targetY)
      Determines whether this ray is in range of a specified target. Being "in range" is defined as having the position of the ray be strictly inside a box around the specified target position with a width and height of 2 * margin, where margin = 1.0 tiles.
      Parameters:
      targetX - the x position of the ray's target.
      targetY - the y position of the ray's target.
      Returns:
      true if this ray is in range of the specified target position.

    • getType

      public String getType()
      Identifies this Moveable object as a Ray. This method always returns the string literal "Ray".
      Specified by:
      getType in class Moveable
      Returns:
      the string literal "Ray".
